name: World Cafe: Systemic Change
location: Dream Impact 夢創成真, Unit C, 4/F 760 Cheung Sha Wan Road Hong Kong, KOW
about: How can we position ourselves to drive systemic change?Creating meaningful impact requires more than passion — it starts with understanding our place within the system, the relationships and interactions within it, and making strategic moves that create ripple effects.Join us for the next World Café: Systemic Change session, where we’ll explore how to map our role in complex systems, identify key relationships, and design actions that lead to lasting impact. Whether you’re in policy, advocacy, or social innovation, this is your chance to reflect, share insights, and co-create strategies to amplify your work's transformative potential.📍 World Café is an interactive dialogue format where participants rotate between small-group conversations, then gather insights together. It’s designed for shared learning, deeper connection, and collective clarity.我們如何定位自己以推動系統性變革？創造有意義的影響不僅僅需要熱情——它始於了解我們在系統中的位置、系統內的關係和互動，並採取能夠產生連鎖效應的策略行動。加入我們的下一場 《世界咖啡館：系統性變革》 ，一起探索如何繪製自己在複雜系統中的角色、識別關鍵關係，並設計能帶來持久影響的行動。不論您從事的是政策、倡導還是社會創新，這都是一次反思、分享見解並共同創建策略的絕佳機會，助您加倍工作帶來的潛在影響。📍 世界咖啡館是一種互動式對話形式，透過小組輪流討論及集體收穫，加深彼此連結，共同學習，凝聚智慧。按此了解更多有關世界咖啡館的資訊。What is World Cafe?World Cafe is a discussion format driven by intentionally crafted questions, designed for 12 or more people to Think Together. 🌎☕️ ​In the process, participants are divided into small groups to discuss a question, and then join a new group to discuss the next one. After that, everyone comes together to share what they learned. We'll be able to take home the main ideas, themes, and insights that emerged from the discussions. Click here to learn more about World Cafe.What are the objectives?Understand the journey of driving changes 了解推動改變的過程Aware of one's innate potential as a changemaker 認清大家的內在改變潛力Gain hope, confidence, and inspiration from the community 從社群中重拾希望、自信和靈感公眾 Public admission: HK$180夢創會員 Dream Impact members: HK$150*Price inclusive of sandwiches and drinks*票價包括三文治及飲品Language : English as primary language. Depends on the participants, we may use Cantonese for discussion as well語言：英文為主要媒介。視乎參加者，我們可以用廣東話進行討論

name: ICE Cultural Exploration Night - Pakistan Night
location: ICE Office, 1208 Houtex Industrial Building 16 Hung To Road Kwun Tong, KOW
about: Join us for an unforgettable evening as we explore the captivating culture of Pakistan - with a delicious twist! Experience firsthand the traditions, rich real-life stories, and bold flavors that make Pakistan so unique. All from our local Pakistani cultural sharers. In this interactive event, you'll dive into the nation’s heritage and then jump into a hands-on cooking workshop where you'll learn how to create a cherished Pakistani snack that bursts with flavour.Whether you're a seasoned home chef or just curious to try something new, get ready to mix, stir, and laugh your way through an fun culinary adventure. Connect with fellow food enthusiasts in a warm, upbeat atmosphere that promises to leave you inspired and craving more. Let's cook, learn, and celebrate Pakistan together!Reserve Your Spot Today! 🎟️Spaces for this exclusive Pani Puri experience are limited, so secure your spot now! Whether you're a food enthusiast, a cultural explorer, or simply seeking a unique and delicious experience, we promise to captivate your senses and leave you with cherished memories.Looking forward to seeing you there!日期 Date: Saturday, 19 July 2025時間 Time: 19:00 - 21:00地點 Venue: ICE Office (address)費用 Fee: $50 (to cover for ingredients)名額 Max 10 guestsPlease note:We will be in touch with you through email or WhatsApp regarding any latest updates regarding the event._________________By registering for our events on Eventbrite, you agree to our privacy policy (https://icehongkong.com/privacy), and that your personal information will go to our newsletter system, Mailerlite, from which you will receive our newsletters from now on. Should you wish to have your information removed from Mailerlite, please make a direct request to ice@icehongkong.com._________________Organisation Introduction:We are Inter Cultural Education (ICE), a social enterprise aiming to educate people to appreciate and be able to accept the cultural diversity of the world. ICE has helped more than 30,000 people in Hong Kong to connect and understand the world better through cross-cultural dialogues.In the past 10 years, ICE has worked with people from more than 85 countries from all walks of life to promote the solidarity of a local community with the international community. Follow our social media to learn more about world cultures:FacebookInstagram

name: Climate Fresk Hong Kong, Sheung Wan
location: The Hive Poho, New Street #5-13 G/F Hong Kong, HKI
about: What is Climate Fresk?A collaborative workshop putting in simple words the science behind the IPCC reports on climate change—engaging, empowering, and bringing people together around climate action.Join a global movement of 2 million people across 161 countries and 45 languages who have taken part in this workshop!Suitable for all levels, from novices to those looking to deepen their understanding.

Limited seats available. First come, first served. Register now and secure your spot!

name: World Cafe: Gaining Courage
location: Dream Impact 夢創成真, Unit C, 4/F 760 Cheung Sha Wan Road Hong Kong, KOW
about: Meaningful change starts with courage — the courage to face our fears, challenge our limiting beliefs, and take bold steps toward creating the impact we envision. It’s about moving beyond hesitation and stepping into action with confidence and clarity.Join us for the final session of the World Café: Journey of Change series, Gaining Courage, where we’ll explore how to identify the beliefs that hold us back, build resilience, and take transformative steps toward meaningful action. Whether you’re a changemaker in your community, organization, or beyond, this is your last opportunity in this series to reflect, share insights, and co-create bold strategies to turn your vision into reality.📍 World Café is an interactive dialogue format where participants rotate between small-group conversations, then gather insights together. It’s designed for shared learning, deeper connection, and collective clarity.我們如何勇敢推動有意義的改變？有意義的改變始於勇氣——勇氣讓我們面對恐懼、挑戰自己的限制性信念，並大膽邁出實現願景的第一步。這是一種超越猶豫，帶著自信與清晰行動的力量。加入我們的 世界咖啡館：改變之旅 系列最終場，《世界咖啡館：勇氣之試鍊》，一起探索如何識別限制我們的信念，培養韌性，並採取能帶來轉型行動的具體步驟。無論您是在社區、組織，或其他領域推動改變，這是本系列中最後一次機會，讓您反思、分享見解，並共同創建大膽的策略，將您的願景化為現實。📍 世界咖啡館是一種互動式對話形式，透過小組輪流討論及集體收穫，加深彼此連結，共同學習，凝聚智慧。按此了解更多有關世界咖啡館的資訊。What is World Cafe?World Cafe is a discussion format driven by intentionally crafted questions, designed for 12 or more people to Think Together. 🌎☕️ ​In the process, participants are divided into small groups to discuss a question, and then join a new group to discuss the next one. After that, everyone comes together to share what they learned. We'll be able to take home the main ideas, themes, and insights that emerged from the discussions. Click here to learn more about World Cafe.What are the objectives?Understand the journey of driving changes 了解推動改變的過程Aware of one's innate potential as a changemaker 認清大家的內在改變潛力Gain hope, confidence, and inspiration from the community 從社群中重拾希望、自信和靈感公眾 Public admission: HK$180夢創會員 Dream Impact members: HK$150*Price inclusive of sandwiches and drinks*票價包括三文治及飲品Language : English as primary language. Depends on the participants, we may use Cantonese for discussion as well語言：英文為主要媒介。視乎參加者，我們可以用廣東話進行討論

name: Women Changemakers Gathering in HK: Sound Healing & Creative Writing
location: Dream Impact, Unit C, 4/F, 760 Cheung Sha Wan Road Hong Kong, KOW
about: A safe place for women changemakers (and aspiring women changemakers) to meet one another;A small-scale gathering where you can actually have intentional conversations with everyone;A community you show up and participate equally as an agent of change;A space to exchange stories and find inspirations to bring collective impact;A tribe you can come back to as your support network and build intergenerational friendships.This is what this gathering is about. For women changemakers.On August 10 Sunday afternoon, Carmen Chan of Girls Be Change and Dorothy Lam of Dream Impact are going to team up with published writer Gillian Del Mundo and certified sound meditation healer Carol Lee, to have this special community gathering to connect changemaking, creative writing, and sound healing together. Let's explore our inner creativity and voice to lead change from within.It is a gathering where everyone shows up as an equal participant, questioning and chatting. No panel. No presentation. No speech. Just intentional conversations.Come join us on Aug 10 (Sun) for an afternoon to meet other fellow women changemakers and explore your creativity via soundhealing and writing!What is Women Changemakers Community Series?The idea began in the summer of 2023 when two changemakers in Hong Kong, Carmen (Girls Be Change) and Dorothy (Dream Impact), questioned and envisioned what an ideal community is. We need a safe place among women changemakers to have organic meetups, intentional conversations and idea exchange with social ease, find inspirations and encouragement from each other, and build authentic friendships and support networks.The first Women Changemakers Community Gathering was held in Hong Kong on March 8, 2024 at International Women’s Day. Ever since then, Girls Be Change cohosted with 20 (and counting) organizations and gathered over 150 (and counting) women changemakers in Hong Kong, Indonesia, Kenya, and Tanzania. With 15+ gatherings around the globe, a vibrant community of global women changemakers was formed and connected virtually to raise questions, exchange ideas, and celebrate wins.​Co-organizers:

name: Anti-Loneliness Club | Dinner with Strangers: Hong Kong
location: Restaurant of the Week, 5 Connaught Road Central #25/F Hong Kong, HKI
about: When was the last time you did something completely spontaneous? Our series groups together complete strangers for a fun night out. That's right, you sign up, and we book the restaurant. We know life can get busy. Don't forget to spend time making new friends! Why do city life alone when you can build your community with us. Embrace the awkwardness of meeting new people for the first time blindly: all ages, interests, hobbies, and backgrounds. This project is to host dinners in 100 cities to combat loneliness in the modern world while supporting locally owned businesses.Each month, dinner is held at a different restaurant. These dinners are not directly associated with the restaurants, but are simply based on a table reservation.This micro-event is intended to be for 4-6 people maximum. If the evening you signed up for does not hit the minimum number of signups, please be open to joining us on another night with a fuller group. Check out our feature in Eventbrite's 2025 TRNDS report about embracing the micro-event trend.How does it work?After you register, you'll be emailed an introduction message. We'll stay in touch with you leading up to the night of the dinner. Expect a Final Details email the day of.*Your registration does not include your individual food and drink purchases. A paid ticket simply makes you more committed to actually showing up.*Sign up one time, and you'll join our database to be invited to all dinners.*These outings are intended to help people make friends. These are not singles gatherings.*If you sign up the day of the gathering and do not get a welcoming message from us in time, simply email ermantourageimpact@gmail.com, request a refund, or please be open to joining us on another evening.Our vision is simple: we take the no gimmicks approach to networking. No need for yet another app to take up space on your phone - just four walls and a roof and good food for people to connect :) We coordinate with you directly, human-to-human.If you have any more questions, please contact ermantourageimpact@gmail.com!Brought to you by event series Ermantourage.You can also take a look at our main event calendar via Posh for coffee meets, evening hangouts, and more!

name: You're Invited to the Journey to the Land of the Pharaohs! ✨
location: WORKSHOP UNIT NO. 3 ON 4TH FLOOR, HUNG TO INDUSTRIAL BUILDING, NO. 80 HUNG TO ROAD KWUN TONG, KOW
about: Let’s discover what papyrus really is, how it was made, and even try using it in a cool activity! 📝🌿📸 Dress up in Pharaonic-style clothes and capture the moment with amazing photos — it’s your chance to look like a Pharaoh or Queen! 👑  🍢 And don’t worry, we’ll end the day with a BBQ lunch together! Good vibes, great food, and fun learning.🫱 Bring your friends, bring your smiles — let’s enjoy, learn, and celebrate heritage together.

name: Lisca Bianca, Born Free: The Dream of a Boat That Became a Collective Hope
location: Blue Room, Soho House Hong Kong, 33 Des Voeux Road West Sheung Wan, HKI
about: As an additional event for the screening of Lisca Bianca and Metamorfosi – Story of a Song of Wood at EU-Asia Docs, the Italian Cultural Institute is hosting a talk on the meaningful project with the founder of the Lisca Bianca Association, Elio Lo Cascio, and the director of the homonymous documentary Giuseppe Galante. Elio will share his experience in the project and how Lisca Bianca affects the lives of the participants.A Q&A session with both Elio and Giuseppe on the project, will be conducted after the sharing. Participants will come together afterwards for a convivial gathering.“It’s a story I would describe as magical, in the young people who participate in our programs, I see a deep transformation: they begin to believe in themselves again. They learn that achieving a dream takes courage, hard work, sacrifice, and passion—things they often thought they had lost.”Elio Lo Cascio, president of the Lisca Bianca Association.Lisca Bianca is a 12-meter schooner that once set sail with the aim to travel around the world. In 2013, Lisca Bianca was found abandoned in a shipyard in Palermo, days away from demolition. That’s when sociologist and sailing enthusiast Elio Lo Cascio, along with naval architect Francesco Belvisi, stepped in. Moved by the story told in the travel diary written by Sergio Albeggiani, the previous owner of Lisca Bianca, they saw the boat’s potential as more than a relic: it could become a floating workshop of rebirth.The Lisca Bianca Association was officially founded in 2014 with great help from sponsors and organizations. The restoration of the schooner involved the help from the Palermo juvenile detention center, residents of the Sant’Onofrio recovery community, unaccompanied migrant minors, and individuals recovering from workplace injuries.Over time, Lisca Bianca became the heart of a broader vision: vocational training, social inclusion, sailing programs, sustainable tourism, and initiatives in the green and blue economy. On land, the project found a home in Scalo 5B, a vibrant social space in Palermo. At sea, it continues to welcome those in search of direction and a second chance.Lisca Bianca, born free—continues to sail toward new horizons.Click here for the official website of the Lisca Bianca Association. (In Italian only)

name: 【DX設計館 | Everday+常物】常物在生活分享會 | INFORMAL SOLUTIONS Sharing
location: DX design hub, DX design hub 280 Tung Chau Street Sham Shui Po, KOW
about: 【DX設計館 | Everday+常物】展覽分享會: 常物在生活你有想過日常生活的物品還有可以用作什麼用途嗎?德國攝影師Michael Wolf曾拍攝的有關香港「Informal Solutions」（民間智慧）作品的啟發，「Everyday+常物」展覽帶你重新發現生活中物件的無限可能！這次創意分享會，我們邀請到ISLANDERS島民分享對深水埗社區日常物的觀察，以及透過工作坊與公眾找尋常物再創造的視覺文化地圖。同時，亦邀請了獨立策展人、設計教育學者及民間博物館計劃發起人之一的蕭競聰，分他其以「日常物件」作為設計、創意研究議題的案例，由《唔知做乜嘅設計》、《尋找無名設計師》展覽、《揦西設計》 到《「不棄的日常造形一家親Undiscarded Everyday》」大家一起探索對日常物的觀察與詮釋。歡迎親子家庭參與，一起來發掘日常中的創意火花！活動詳情:日期：2025年7月19日 （星期六）時間：15:00-16:30地點：九龍深水埗通州街280號DX設計館3樓3樓滙館講者：ISLANDERS島民、蕭競聰、名額：30人 (適合12歲或以上）語言：粵語費用：免費【DX design hub】 'Everyday Plus' Exhibition Talk: INFORMAL SOLUTIONSEver wondered what new life old everyday ordinary objects could have? Inspired by German photographer Michael Wolf’s ‘Informal Solutions’ series, the ‘Everyday Plus’ Exhibition invites you to rediscover the endless possibilities of daily objects!In this creative sharing session, ISLANDERS will share their unique observations of everyday objects in Sham Shui Po, guiding participants through a workshop to create a visual culture map that reimagines these items. We are also to have curator, design scholar and educator Siu King-chung, who will share his extensive research journey on everyday objects, from exhibitions like ‘Designs that You Don’t Know What To Do With’, ‘In Search of Anonymous Designers’, ‘Lesser Design’, and more. Join us to explore fresh perspectives on the stories and creative interpretations of daily objects.Details:Date: 2025.7.19 (Sat)Time: 15:00 - 16:30Venue: Tha Chmber, 3/F DX design hub, 280 Tung Chau Street, Sham Shui Po, Kowloon.No. of Participants: 30 (12 years old or above)Language: CantoneseInstructor: ISLANDERS、Siu King ChungAdmission: Free Registration*Spaces are available on a first-come, first-served basis.

name: UNHEARD 2025: Ukraine: Nightlife in Resistance (2023)
location: Kino, Eaton House (Co-working), 380 Nathan Road 1/F Hong Kong, KOW
about: Ukraine: Nightlife in Resistance, will tell six unique stories of various industry figures from different parts of the country, uncovering the price they’ve paid for this life- changing transformation.Directed by Maksym NakonechnyiRuntime: 45 minsLangauge: Ukranian w/ English subtitlesUkraine: Nightlife in Resistance 將講述來自該國不同地區的六個獨特故事，揭示他們為這場改變生活的轉變所付出的代價。導演：Maksym Nakonechnyi片長：45分鐘語言：烏克蘭語（附英語字幕）

name: 食得醒．活得勁 | Eat Well, Live Well
location: 16/F, Chun Wo Commercial Centre 23-27 Wing Wo Street Sheung Wan, HKI
about: 【💪🏻🎨有肌會發達，拍定手先啦！｜NEVER SKIP GAME DAY】藝術家用身體感受世界，運動員以身體衝破界限。無論你揮筆、奔跑，還是靜靜沉思，一個被好好照顧的身體，永遠都是你最堅實的夥伴。根據心理學家Snyder的「希望理論」（Hope Theory），健康的身體不僅是希望的結果，更是希望的來源。當我們透過飲食滋養身體時，事實上是在為自己建立更多追尋目標的動力，以及解決困難的能力。然而，飲食作為人類的本能，卻隨年月變得曲折離奇，我們越大越發現自己「唔識食」。本應滋養我們的飲食，竟變成健康問題的來源。如果良藥必苦、糖衣帶毒，通往健康的道路是荊棘滿途，試問有誰想上路？依家阿彤帶個喜訊畀大家，其實藝術家唔食風都可以有啖好食！在這場結合飲食與身體意識的工作坊中，健身教練/寫作人阿日將帶領我們進行肌肉訓練，然後廚師/雜誌編輯Alan將為大家準備健康的簡餐，邀請你一起探索食物如何幫助身體達到理想狀態、如何回應創作與運動的節奏──從「吃得好」開始「活得好」，將希望注入生活，讓飲食成為文化實踐的一部分。Artists use their bodies to feel the world, while athletes use their bodies to push boundaries. Whether painting, running, or quietly thinking, a well-cared-for body is always your strongest partner. Psychologist Snyder's "Hope Theory" suggests a healthy body is not only the result of hope but also a source of hope. When we nourish our bodies through food, we build motivation to chase goals and strengthen problem-solving ability.When it comes to health, something as intuitive as eating has become unnecessarily complicated; what nourishes us has now caused problems. How might we eat properly without compromising gastronomical pursuits?Here’s a good news from the leading artist Tung: there’s a way out! In this workshop on food and body awareness, fitness coach/writer Yat will lead us through muscle training. Subsequently, chef/editor Alan will prepare a healthy, light meal. Explore how food helps your body reach its ideal state and responds to creativity and exercise rhythms. Starting with "eat well,” we'll make food an integral part of our cultural practice as a way to “live well” with hope._______________________費用全免(參加者須預繳港幣100元可退還按金)Free (participants are required to settle a refundable deposit at HKD100 to secure their registration)_______________________導師 Instructors羅維日（阿日）Law Wai Yat (Yat)健齡13年，由35吋肚腩到24/7腹肌，期望諸君食得開心操得順心，不再把白烚無鹽誤會成健康的不二法門。With 13 years of fitness experience, gone from a 35-inch waist to having abs all day. Hope everyone enjoy eating and exercising without thinking plain boiled food is the only healthy option.虞興華 Alan Yu《Sample樣本》雜誌編輯，因貪食而轉行，現職廚師。相信透過理解食物與技術的本質，可以讓簡單的食物也變得美味。最愛的食物是漢堡和牛扒。Editor of Sample magazine turned chef. With belief in simple food can be tasty with the right skills. His favourite foods are burgers and steak.

name: My Role, My Power
location: Diversity Hub, Chungking Mansions 36-44 Nathan Road Kowloon, KOW

name: 前深水埗配水庫免費導賞團
location: Ex-Sham Shui Po Service Reservoir (Ex-SSPSR), Mission Hill Shek Kip Mei Hong Kong, KOW
about: （僅限女青活學中心年證持有人報名。如果您沒有有效的 APH 帳戶，請在此處註冊：https://clle-ywca.com/454JUv4）女青活學中心誠邀您參與於八月二十八日（星期四）下午進行的「前深水埗配水庫」免費導賞團。前深水埗配水庫獲古物諮詢委員會確認為一級歷史建築。水務署現有限度開放配水庫予市民參觀，希望藉此讓市民可以認識前深水埗配水庫的歷史背景和欣賞其內部結構，從而提升公眾對水務歷史建築及文物保育的意識。活動日期：八月二十八日（星期四）截止報名日期： 八月十日 （星期日）集合時間：下午一時四十五分開始時間：下午二時至三時三十分地點：前深水埗配水庫（集合地點詳情將以電郵公告）對象：十八歲以上成人語言： 廣東話（名額有限，先到先得。）水務署參觀指引及規則集散點與前深水埗配水庫之間需步行約15分鐘，路程主要為狹窄山路及梯級，需要一定的體力，申請者於申請時應衡量其團體成員實際身體狀況，考慮是否適合參加該導賞團及需要由照料者陪同和協助參加導賞團；參加者於整個行程中有責任對其自身安全負責。本署職員有權因應當時實際情況及需要拒絕任何人士參與活動。參加者需準時到達集合地點，逾時不候。本署職員可要求參加者展示申請確認電郵及身份證明文件以作核實。如有需要，本署職員亦會致電確認參加者身分。如因突發情況需要更改集合時間和/或地點，甚或取消參觀活動，本署將於可行的情況下盡早透過電話通知參加者。若3號或以上熱帶氣旋警告信號；或黃色或以上暴雨警告信號於參觀活動開始前3小時內仍然生效，當天的參觀活動將會自動取消。 在一般情況下，本署將於下一個工作天早上更新有關的紀錄。本署會視乎天氣或場地實際情況決定繼續或暫停參觀活動。本署有權取消任何預先安排的參觀活動，但會事先給予通知。本署不會為受活動取消影響的申請者作出補團或特別安排。為了不影響參觀活動，參加者於參觀期間禁止使用閃光或照明器具、無人機航拍、自拍杆和腳架拍照或錄影。除導盲犬、助聽犬及服務犬外，請勿攜帶任何寵物進入前深水埗配水庫。本署將為所有合資格的參加者購買本地旅遊保險，為每位參加者提供最多不少於港幣$100,000之個人意外及醫療保險。本署將於參觀活動期間進行拍攝及錄影，有關之拍攝相片及錄影片段或會作日後推廣及宣傳之用。參加者如不同意上述安排請告知活動當天的導賞員並簽署「不授權活動照片及錄影片段作宣傳用途」表格。凡由參觀活動或任何與此有關或連帶的目的所引起或引致對參加者或其財產造成的任何損毀、損傷或損失，本署均毋須負起任何索償、費用、毀壞及開支的責任。

Please feel free to mingle with us!***Notes to ParticipantsPlease change your RSVP to “not going” if you can’t attend the event.Thank you.==================================[NETM會議日期及時間]每月第一個星期日 (普通話/粵語) 2:30-4:30 (GMT+8) 及每月第三個星期日 (英文) 2:30-4:30 (GMT+8)*歡迎提早15分鐘參與會議和我們聊聊天想了解NETM？ 可到我們的網站/FB或IG了解詳情FB: https://cutt.ly/BmdLdxYIG @netmhk我們的網站(https://newexperiencehktmc.com/***[為何要參加Toastmasters國際演講會？]國際演講會是一個教育性質非牟利組織，旨在協助會員提升溝通、演講及領導技巧。參加國際演講會能...培養演講能力，建立自信磨練溝通技巧，促進成長發揮領導潛能，提升專業技能增強語文能力及表達力建立人際網絡，互勵互勉[例會架構]備稿演講 (每講5-7分鐘)2.即席演講 (每講2分鐘）3.演講及工作人員檢討及評論[如何參加]按 “參加”鍵後依時參加即可歡迎非會員於即興演講環節參與演講及和我們交流***注意事項如未能參加會議，請更新參與狀態為 “不出席”謝謝

name: Bridging Generational Gaps - Hong Kong, China
location: Hong Kong, Hong Kong Hong Kong
about: 📣 Are You a Parent of a Child Struggling with Mental Health? 🧡Feeling unsure of how to best support a child dealing with mental health difficulties can be incredibly overwhelming. This occasion is planned specifically for parents like you who are eager to more deeply understand, connect with, and guide their child during these tumultuous times.This event is tailored to support parents who are naturally relationship-driven and have a desire to influence their child's life positively.You'll gather alongside expert child psychologists and parents who've experienced similar struggles. During our time together, you will:1. Learn how to communicate more effectively with your child, fostering greater openness and understanding in your relationship.2. Acquire tools to assist your child in managing emotions and building resilience.3. Network with other parents, creating a supportive community.4. Recognize how your natural talents and inclinations can best serve your child during these difficult times.A single step can create significant change. We're warmly inviting you to be part of our event: "You Deserve Peace" through empowering your mental health. Together, we can brighten these challenges and forge a better future for our children.This event aims to provide support and education for parents. It does not replace the advice of medical or mental health professionals. Always consult a healthcare professional for personal medical advice.

name: Bridging Leadership and Parenting - Hong Kong, China
location: Hong Kong, Hong Kong Hong Kong
about: 📣 Support for Parents: Helping Your Child Navigate Mental Health Challenges 🧡Navigating the uncharted waters of your child's mental health can feel overwhelming, even more when you're used to dealing with complex tasks and making important decisions. We've designed an event specifically for parents like you who bring a strength of leadership into every area of their lives.This unique event will resonate with your natural skills of strategic thinking, goal-setting, and problem-solving - qualities that are essential in supporting a child through such difficulties.Join us as leading child psychiatrists and experienced parents come together to share their insights and personal experiences. You can expect to:Learn effective strategies to communicate with your child, promoting understanding and openness.Acquire tools for helping your child manage emotions and bolster resilience.Network with other parents who share both your challenges and your leadership approach, fostering a community of mutual support.Uncover how your inherent skills in strategy and problem-solving can greatly aid your child during these challenging times.A single informed action can make a significant difference. So join us for our event: "Parents Guiding Through Mental Health Challenges: A Leadership Approach". Here, we will transform these hardships into opportunities for growth together.Please note, this event is designed to educate and support parents. It does not replace professional medical or mental health advice. Always consult with a healthcare professional for personalized medical advice.Join us for insights into managing children's mental health. Learn strategies, meet fellow parents, use your leadership skills. #MentalHealthParenting

name: 少雪齋與香港大學圖書館合辦 「夢幻敦煌：重現敦煌大美之境」展覽 百餘壁畫展品1:1重現敦煌洞窟
location: The University of Hong Kong - Main Library, 1-3/F, Main Library, The University of Hong Kong Pok Fu Lam Road Pok Fu Lam, HKI
about: 少雪齋首次與香港大學圖書館合辦為期三個月的「夢幻敦煌：重現敦煌大美之境」展覽， 於6月7日至9月7日在港大圖書館舉行，公眾人士即日起可免費入場。敦煌研究院、香港大學圖書館及少雪齋共同精心策劃此次展覽，是敦煌研究院首次與香港高等學府及民辦機構合作籌辦展覽。展覽包括78件/套具有代表性敦煌藝術品，通過六大主題「第一單元：絲路漫漫」、「第二單元：壁上丹青」、「第三單元：莊嚴佛宮」、「第四單元：萬像人間」、「第五單元：石室寶藏」及「第六單元：悠遊淨土」與沉浸式數字影片，展現敦煌石窟千年匠心的技藝與文化傳承的生命力。重點推介「莊嚴佛宮」內敦煌莫高窟第45窟，以1:1精準複製首次在香港完整展出，這洞窟佔地面積約25平方米，高近5米。洞窟內四面牆身及藻井（窟頂）均有唐代壁畫設計，窟頂現傾斜視覺效果，同時包括七具各具特色的彩塑造像，還原現存敦煌莫高窟主尊佛陀結跏趺坐於須彌座上，兩邊隨侍弟子、菩薩、天王等圍繞聽法的盛境。其中菩薩造像獨具特色，以女性軀幹為原型，呈「S」形彎曲、體柔美、嘴角微翹、妙目靈動。與之相映，天王造像形像雄強有力，盡顯威猛剛強。三樓展區是「悠遊淨土」以數位藝術方式沉浸呈現敦煌佛教藝術風格，除了敦煌飛天和音樂舞蹈壁畫外，亦設有大型屏幕動畫區播放《敦煌壁影》，用動態手法呈現靜態壁畫內容，讓畫中人物在觀眾前舞動起來。 展品還有10個莫高窟獨特藻井圖案，用燈箱掛在天花板，地下設有座墊，可供觀賞人士躺下仰望，感受莫高窟不同藻井圖案的豐富視覺效果。展覽是「香港大學圖書館少雪齋文化節」的重要環節，其他活動包括五場公開講座、兩場文化表演和八場工作坊，16項精彩活動全部爆滿。「夢幻敦煌：重現敦煌大美之境」展覽地址：香港薄扶林路香港大學圖書館1至3樓；免費入場展期：2025年6月7日至9月7日星期一至五：8:30am-9:00pm;星期六：9:30am-5:00pm;星期日及公眾假期休館聯繫電話：(852) 6125 8173 (Ms Chow)少雪齋 IG：chamberofyoungsnow文化節於6月7日舉行開幕典禮， 多位政府官員及學者出席致辭，包括港大署理教務長兼副校長（教學）何立仁教授、民政及青年事務局局長麥美娟女士、敦煌研究院陳列中心副主任及研究館員王慧慧女士、少雪齋創辦人孫漢明博士、香港大學首席信息主管及大學圖書館館長伍麗娟女士等。伍女士致詞表示感謝少雪齋的鼎力支持，令展覽規模超過原計劃10倍。歷任敦煌研究院院長及黨委書記，現敦煌研究院研究員、學術委員會主任委員的趙聲良博士參加開幕禮並在其後發表學術演講。敦煌研究院隸屬甘肅省文物局，是全球敦煌學研究的權威機構、是中国擁有世界文化遺產數量最多、跨區域範圍最廣的文博管理機構、國家一級博物館。在國際文化遺產保護領域具有舉足輕重的地位。是次文化節以規模空前的展覽內容、豐富的展區設計及創新的數位藝術展覽方式，吸引中西學界和市民入場參觀，廣獲文化界好評。系列高水平的文化活動對敦煌藝術的深度詮釋，和推廣的實踐力道，展現出主辦方在學術與大眾之間搭建橋樑的堅持與用心。文化節展期三個月，橫跨整個暑假，相信會成為今夏香港文化界其一盛事及旅遊觀光打卡熱點。關於少雪齋少雪齋 Chamber of Young Snow 是由李師成博士於2016年推動中西文化交流為目標的非政府組織。李博士於2005年創立居士林，致力於向香港市民介紹佛學的義理及實踐佛法的概念。李博士熱愛中國藝術文化，並全心投入其發展。他的機構不僅推廣文化，還收藏了從漢代到當代的中國藝術品，並資助北京大學、香港大學及嶺南大學等著名學府，促進文化研究和教育。李博士在香港新城財經台主持「談文說藝」和「人生百味」兩項節目，粉絲以十萬計。少雪齋透過展覽、工作坊、講座和演出等多樣化活動，吸引年輕人和社區成員參與，特別關注青年人的發展，鼓勵他們探索文化藝術的多樣性。

name: UNHEARD 2025: Shared Frequencies: How to build community through radio
location: Kino, Eaton House (Co-working), 380 Nathan Road 1/F Hong Kong, KOW
about: A panel discussion with an assemble of community radios from Asia & Europe discussing the enduring medium of radio and the myriad ways in which  it builds community.w/Arthur Bray from FM Belowground (Hong Kong)Chris  from Res Radio (Vienna)Dana from The Nifty Radio(Jakarta)James from Eaton Radio (Hong Kong)___________________FM Belowground:FM Belowground is a community radio station located in the basement of Landmark Building with a varied programme ranging from local dance and indie bands to podcasts to DJing workshops connecting people from different backgrounds and creative practices.Res Radio:Res.Radio is a non-commercial community webradio based in Vienna to strengthen and display subcultural genres. From its founding in 2019, the radio grew into a multicultural community/platform featuring artists with many different backgrounds. Within this platform people connect, exchange ideas and create content around music across all genres and talks, which addresses topics like contemporary culture, social injustice and other phenomena. Res.Radio is a space of diverse artistic freedom and is made from people for people.___________________The Nifty Radio:The Nifty Radio (Nifty) is an alternative music radio and archiving platform community-based in Bogor, notably in the electronic music scene. Providing a place for DJs, musicians, and music geeks from all over the world to promote, distribute, and create new connections, in line with the growth of the music ecosystem surrounds them. Presenting various types of music, and the sub-genres in it, also come with the artistic and visuals that represent the circumstances of the city.@mortarwithpestle / @theniftyradio____________________Eaton Radio:Eaton Radio empowers grassroots storytelling and supports emerging, contemporary, and historic underground music. We’ve produced over 2000+ shows of talk radio and music through a rich and varied rotation of DJ mixes, interviews, and regular shows.

name: 【DX設計館 | Everyday+常物】常物公眾導賞團  | Everyday Plus Curatorial Guided Tours
location: DX design hub, DX design hub 280 Tung Chau Street Sham Shui Po, KOW
about: 【DX設計館 | Everyday+常物 】常物公眾導賞團〈Everyday+常物〉的策展團隊由Talking Hands主理人徐巧詩和Milk Design的創意總監利志榮組成，展覽內容以日常物為創作主題原點，從設計師角度出發，與大眾分享、探索設計與生活的密切關係。公眾導賞團將由策展團隊主持，在每個月特定周六的下午時段駐場，分享展覽背後的設計案例，聆聽大家與日常物件的生活故事。活動詳情:日期：2025年6月28日 | 2025年7月12日 | 2025年8月23日時間：1500 - 1600 | 1700 - 1800地點：九龍深水埗通州街280號DX設計館地下前館講者：Everyday+常物策展團隊Talking Hands 徐巧詩、Milk Design利志榮、2+2＝5羅逸文人數：15人 (適合12歲以上）費用：免費 (名額有限，額滿即止)【DX design hub| Everyday Plus】Everyday Plus Curatorial Guided ToursWhat connects design and everyday life? Let’s start with the objects around us.The curatorial team of Everyday Plus is led by Ire Tsui, founder of Talking Hands, together with Chi-wing Lee, creative director of Milk Design. The exhibition showcases everyday objects from the designers’ perspectives, exploring the close connection between design and daily life for the public.The curatorial team will host public guided tours on selected… of each month.They will share the design stories behind the exhibition and engage in conversations, inviting everyone to share their own life stories related to everyday objects.DetailsDate: 28.6.2025 (Sat) | 12.7.2025 (Sat) | 23.8.2025 (Sat)Time: 1500 - 1600 | 1700 - 1800Venue: The Square, G/F DX design hub, 280 Tung Chau Street, Sham Shui Po, Kowloon.Speakers: Everyday Plus Curatorial TeamLanguage: CantoneseNo. of Participants: 15 (12 years old or above)Fee: Free of Charge (Limited spaces available. First come, first served)

name: 2025 Hong Kong Law Fair
location: Hall 5G, Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre, 1  Expo Drive Wan Chai, HKI
about: Welcome to the 2025 Hong Kong Law Fair!Meet over 50 leading law firms, professional legal organisations and law schools in Hong Kong - all gathered under one roof to offer you insights, guidance, and opportunities to connect with the legal profession.This is your chance to ask questions, explore career paths, and build networks that matter.Free admission is offered to penultimate LLB, double law degree and JD students. Law students from other years are also welcome to register for free admission, but is subject to availability.Non-law and LLM students are welcome to attend with a registration fee of HKD 500, and admission is subject to a quota.Registration is required to attend, and successful registrants will receive a QR code before the event.We look forward to seeing you at Hall 5G, Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre!*In the event of adverse weather conditions (e.g. T8 or above, or a Black Rainstorm Signal), the Law Fair Committee will consider rescheduling the event to Sunday, 7 September 2025, subject to venue availability. Further details will be announced if this occurs.

name: GENAI Summit
location: The Wave, 4 Hing Yip Street 10th Floor Kwun Tong, KOW
about: THE BIGGEST GENAI EVENT IN HONG KONG STARTS SOON, DONT MISS OUT香港 GenAI Summit是一項在香港舉辦的頂尖科技盛會，旨在匯聚香港本地的商界領袖與人工智能 (AI)創新者，提供一個重要的交流與合作平台，讓您深入了解及探索生成式 AI (Generative AI) 在各行各業的實際應用。The GenAI Summit is a cutting-edge event held in Hong Kong bringing together business leaders and AI Innovators in Hong Kong under one roof, the chance to explore real world applications and apply them to your business.GenAI Summit is your one-stop destination to explore the future of enterprise and consumer AI creative solutions, the place to be for Generative AI & Digital Transformations.Brilliant minds converging to explore cutting-edge advancements, from machine learning breakthroughs to real-world AI creative applications. You’ll dive into thought-provoking talks from industry leaders that inspire bold ideas, while networking sessions connect you with innovators, collaborators, and mentors in the AI space.#Artificial intelligenceWHAT TO EXPECTAI IN REAL WORLD APPLICATIONSINDUSTRY LEADERS IN GEN AIFUTURE GEN AI INNOVATIONSOfficial Website : https://www.hkgen.ai/

name: The Justice Conference Asia 2025
location: The Vine Church, 29 Burrows St Hong Kong Island
about: The Justice Conference Asia returns to Hong Kong with a renewed vision and a steadfast commitment to advancing God’s heart for justice in our city and across the region. This year’s theme, Re-Imagine, invites us to challenge our imagination, disrupt our realities, and energise our actions for practical outcomes. We invite you to join us as we explore what it means to envision a world transformed by God’s boundless vision of human flourishing and justice.

name: 絲竹和韻 — 拔萃男書院國樂會＆TCO 附設青少年國樂團音樂會2025
location: Diocesan Boys' School Yip Kit Chuen Concert Hall, 131 Argyle Street Mongkok, KOW

name: Summer Nights @ Shaw Auditorium: Robot Dreams
location: Main Hall, Shaw Auditorium, HKUST HONG KONG, NT
about: 逸夫演藝中心誠邀您參加盛夏電影放映活動，一同欣賞溫馨感人的動畫電影《汪汪夢裡人》。本片以狗狗與機器人之間的深厚友情為主題，透過精緻的動畫畫面與電影歌曲，細膩描繪孤獨、夢想與現實交織的情感旅程。全片無對白，但每個動作與表情都勝過千言萬語。這將是一場讓您放鬆心情、感受真摯情感的觀影體驗，誠邀您蒞臨共度美好時光！Shaw Auditorium cordially invites you to a summer film screening featuring the heartwarming animated film "Robot Dreams." This touching story showcases the profound friendship between a dog and a robot, brought to life through exquisite animation and music. With no dialogue, the film conveys deep emotions through gestures and expressions. Join us for this captivating cinematic experience that promises to soothe your mind and touch your heart!故事簡介榮獲奧斯卡最佳動畫長片提名，感動橫掃全球60+項大獎及提名，被譽為媲美《優獸大都會》及《星聲夢裡人》的年度最佳電影！單身狗狗厭倦了寂寞的獨居生活，決定購買智能機械人作伴。二人一拍即合，日夜漫遊紐約大街小巷。正當他們以為找到人生中的彼此，命運卻在一次沙灘狂歡後將他們硬生生拆散。狗狗帶著思念回復孤獨的生活日常，機械人則獨自躺在沙灘上幻想著再次回到狗狗身邊……在這場無盡的思念旅程中，有沒有一個重來的機會？SynopsisBased on a graphic novel by Sara Varon, Goya-Award-winning director Pablo Berger’s first venture into animation is a colourful, vibrant and touching buddy drama. To escape solitude, Dog assembles Robot from a build-it-yourself kit. Setting off on a whimsical exploration of New York City, the new best friends develop an inseparable bond as they savour curbside hotdogs and roller-skate through Central Park. However, their friendship is abruptly brought to a halt when an accident leaves Robot stranded on a beach.備註 Remarks:本次放映之影片不設對白。 No Dialogue.電影全長103分鐘。Film Duration: 103 minutes.電影級別: I (適合任何年齡人士觀看)。Film Classification: I (Suitable for All Ages).免費入場，請預先網上報名。 Free admission. Online registration is required.請於放映前15分鐘抵達場地。 Please arrive at the venue 15 minutes before the screening.入場守則 Admission Rules:不設劃位，先到先得。Free-seating on first-come-first-served basis.場內嚴禁飲食。No food and drinks are allowed in the venue.未經許可，請勿攝影、錄音或錄影。Unauthorized photo-taking, audio or video recording is strictly prohibited.主辦單位保留更改節目、演出者及座位安排的權利。如有任何爭議，主辦單位保留最終決定權。The organizer reserves the right to make changes to the program, performers and seating arrangement. In case of dispute, the decision of the organizer shall be final.
